title: 「強制檢疫」原來只係搵義工打電話傾計！！！

replies.msg:
「強制檢疫」原來只係打電話傾計！？
　
早兩日林鄭宣布會８號起要求經中國入境人仕進行強制檢疫，但如何執行所謂「檢疫」就完全唔解釋，大家都好擔心所謂檢疫係咪真係保障到香港人，定只係無牙老虎一隻。而我啱啱收到同學傳來已FC消息，原來「強制檢疫」係咁進行！
　
衛生署招收緊五、六年級既醫學生做義工（係義工，冇錢收冇CSI口罩收，一蚊都冇半個都冇，蒸過既都冇），每節工作八小時，一星期約五節，透過電話進行檢疫工作（"phone medical surveillance"）。

內容包括：
一）受檢疫者有否遵守指示 ("check their compliance")
二）有否不適或徵狀 ("conduct medical surveillance")
三）提供衛生健康建議 ("give health advice as necessary")

電郵內文仲提及，工作量應該會好大好大，所以急需各位學生快啲義務出黎幫手咁話添！
　
如果情況真係咁嚴峻，點解仲唔肯直接封關，咁樣既電話檢疫真係保障到香港人咩？！

#唔聽電話會點cut線又點
#本身以為有條手帶但分分鐘原來仲差
#聽完電話繼續周街走
　
———————————————
更新：收到消息，好似衛生署同樣招收緊護士學生做一樣既工作，求證中！

大五六medic學生做啲咁低能既嘢
仲要免費仲要咁長工時 呢個政府

Dear fellow medics,

The Department of Health (DH) is urgently looking for medical student volunteers to help conduct phone medical surveillance for the novel coronavirus outbreak. They are primarily looking for Year 5 and Year 6 students but help from Year 4 students is much appreciated too.

Duty will be in 8-hour shifts (there will be meal time in between), DH hopes each volunteer can take up 5 shifts a week, but the actual number may vary depending on the number of calls to be made (they expect the number of calls to be huge in the beginning and it will gradually drop).

Briefing and first shift:

(1) 9am-4pm 9 Feb (Sunday) or

(2) 4pm-10pm 9 Feb (Sunday)
Venue: Public Health Laboratory Centre, 382 Nam Cheong Street, Shek Kip Mei

Each volunteer will be given a roster during the briefing, they could exchange duties with each other to match their schedule. There will be meal time in each shift. In case the roster is unfit and no one can exchange duty with, can raise request to in charge.

If you are interested, you can contact DH directly (see numbers in photo) or message me (Gabriel Wong, WhatsApp +852 9522 5928). Please spread this to your friends who would like to help!

同學們，衞生署想搵我哋BN Year 4 and 5 嘅同學，幫手由2月8號開始，去衛生防護中心 (在醫管局總部後面) 幫手每日打電話俾啲在家隔離嘅人士，關心佢哋嘅健康狀況等。全程會有衛生防護中心職員supervise, 唔識答問題都唔緊要，refer番俾職員就得。開工前會有training (暫定日期係今個星期五上晝)。這項是義工工作，參與的同學的hours可以計primary health care clinical placement 嘅clinical hours.

打個電話就可以檢到疫？  OnＬ柒99🧐

I'm relaying this message from the DH👇🏼

The Department of Health (DH) is urgently looking for year 5 and 6 medical student volunteers to help conduct phone medical surveillance for the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Duty will be in 8-hour shifts (there will be meal time in between), DH hopes each volunteer can take up 5 shifts a week, but the actual number may vary depending on the number of calls to be made (they expect the number of calls to be huge in the beginning and it will gradually drop).

Briefing and first shift:
(1) 9am-4pm 9 Feb (Sunday) or
(2) 4pm-10pm 9 Feb (Sunday)

Venue: Public Health Laboratory Centre, 382 Nam Cheong Street, Shek Kip Mei

Each volunteer will be given a roster during the briefing, they could exchange duties with each other to match their schedule. There will be meal time in each shift. In case the roster is unfit and no one can exchange duty with you, you can raise request to in charge.

If you are interested, you can contact DH directly (see numbers in photo) Please spread this to your friends who would like to help!

同學仔
諗吓過去8個月港共同黑警點對待你哋啲FA手足，就知份on9義工係咪值得去
